inn1.comm: 132 kph, full ball angled across Tharanga who gets the front foot across and pushes square.
holds the length back, the perfect line once again as it angles across and good carry too. Tharanga leaves.
ooh, tentative. Tharanga has a feel for a ball well outside off, and as he's been doing all series he plays well in front of the body. Escapes from edging this time.
Gul goes too wide this time, Erasmus doesn't call it a wide, but his hands must have ben twitching. Umar Akmal dives across and takes it in front of Misbah at 1st slip.
a couple of yards outside off, again impressive carry but an easy leave for Tharanga.

a beaut of a ripper to end the over. Lands back of a length outside leg as it angles away, hits the threads and then swerves away like a drunk fiend. Tharanga was groping down the wrong line. No shame in being beaten by that one. Even Bradman would have struggled to edge it.
angled away across Dilshan who lets the ball go.
back of a length, this time Dilshan covers the line and defends to the off side.
hits the seam at 124 kph and gets the ball to cut away from Dilshan, who leaves this time.
this one lands too wide and keeps floating away. It is called a wide, even as Dilshan pulls out of an ambitious dab at it.
that's his line, the ball whistles in on a length around middle and leg and goes across Dilshan, who plays cautiously off the front foot.
again, Dilshan opens the face as he prods forward and steers to point.
ends with another searching delivery, this time it finishes on the pads and Dilshan whips to midwicket for his first run.
that's the Dilshan we all love. Short of a length ball, wide outside off and swinging away into his smashing zone, he gets the front foot across and cracks it with a vengeace through the covers.
Gul over-compensates, on the pads at 138 kph and Dilshan works it square for four more.
the big indipper at 135 kph, the bounce on this track is impressive so far. The ball jags into Dilshan who is pushing forward and he gets into an awry position as it thuds into his midsection.

again cuts him up with a big inducker. How many new-ball bowlers can mix these with the legcutters as well as this man does, and at this pace? Dilshan is again in a mess as he gets the front foot across and into no position to handle the big inward movement.
Dilshan adjusts well, pushes more watchfully to the off side, and covers the line as the ball comes in. Single to point.
squares him up. Tharanga stays on the crease and does his best to cover the line, but the ball keeps going away and takes the outside edge to run away to third man.
angled down the leg side, Tharanga stays inside the line and lets it go.
Tanvir slants this one in prodigiously, this time in the air. Tharanga arrests his forward press to get the bat down on a tentative push drive to mid-on.
better from UT, stays back and defends confidently as the ball swings in.

and gone. Tanvir has bowled a few huge inswingers and now slips in the away-swinger. When he's on song, he gets these to snake about madly. Tharanga didn't spot the movement, he got the front foot out and looked to defend to the off side, but the deviation was too much. The feather carries into Umar's gloves and Tharanga walks.

edged and nearly gone in the slips. Tanvir sends this in from wide of the crease and gets the ball to angle away sharply, the batsman is squared up and edges, I think it dropped just short of first slip who was diving to his right.
width for Dilshan, he heaves furiously through the covers for a couple.
ends with one on the pads, Dilshan on-drives for another couple.
too wide this outswinger from Gul and it called a wide.
back of a length, angling in off the seam and defended to the off side.
Chandimal stays back and defends as he shuffles across. Gul lands this back of a length outside off.
here comes the indipper, Gul's wrist subtly changes position behind the ball - no change in action or drop in pace. Chandimal is inside the line and in no position to play down the ground.
this one ends on the pads, Chandimal looks to nudge square for a single and gets a leg bye. Gul isn't happy with the line, and practices his release a couple of time.

boy, this is the ghost of Dilshan. A pale imitation of the batsman who used to pulp the new ball. What a tame stroke to go. He hasn't sorted out Gul all series, and faithfully nurdles another one into Umar's gloves. It was Gul's peachy away seamer, landing back of a length outside off and going away. Dilshan just sparred at it on the up without getting the foot across. A nothing shot. SL in all sorts of trouble, again.
Sanga shuffles onto the off stump line and defends a length ball to the off side.
keeps it well wide of Chandimal, who doesn't go for it.

gorgeous drive. Helped of course by the fact that mid-on is not where he should normally be. Over-pitched on off stump, Chandimal eases into a rolling drive, getting the front foot in position and powering it all along the turf.
back of a length from over the stumps, he squares him up immediately with the angle and Chandimal defends to the off side off the outer half of the blade.
gets behind the line this time and defends to the off side from the crease.
ooh, Chandimal attempts the wafty steer away from the body as Tanvir swings the ball away from well wide of off stump.
ends with one that lands on leg and seams across. This time Chandimal is solidly behind it.
pacy from Gul, back of a length and very close to Sanga's off stump. He shows good judgement to leave it.
lands on middle this time and holds its line. Sanga stays on the crease and defends to mid-off.
class from Sanga. Short and wide outside off, not quite the fill-your-boots kind of width. Sanga hops across, stays beside the line and unfurls the wrists to send it purring through point.
too straight from Gul, Sanga stays on the crease and punches to mid-on.
Chandimal stays back, rides the bounce and plays a Sehwag-style cut backward of point and gets a couple.
back of a length and angled in sharply to end the over. Chandimal defends from the crease.
Tanvir keeps it short of a length outside off, Sanga spots the angle well and defends.
polite away seamer, angles in and straightens outside off. Sanga leaves.
another one nips away off the seam, and this time it forces Sanga to play. He's squared up and gets an outside edge that dribbles away down to third man for a single.

SL in dire straits now. Chandimal is on his way, after being hoodwinked into giving Younis slip-catching practice. A little unconventional gem of a delivery that, from Tanvir. Swirls out of his snappy wrist, angling across from over the stumps, short of a driving length, it lands on the stumps and then whistles away deceptively. Chandimal was on the back foot, doing his best to read the deviation, and offered the bat in an attempt to guide it square. The ball had other plans, though, it swerved away enough to take the outside edge and Younis takes it really well, low at second slip.
this one slips well down the leg side and Chamara lets it go.
there, beaten again. Angles in, lands on the seam outside off and darts away. Chamara looks puzzled as it buzzes past his outside edge.
finishes with a straight ball on the middle and leg line, defended to the leg side carefully.
short of a length outside off, Sanga hangs back and defends to the off side.
beaten again. Gul slips one with the angle across Sanga's outside edge. He had to play at that from the crease, but at least he wasn't feeling for it away from the body.
short of a length on middle and going across. Defended down the track.
fuller this time, Sanga gets onto the front foot and defends to the off side.
width outside off, Sanga tries to smash it away but finds point with his well-timed cut.
nips away from Sanga, who hangs back and opens the face to defend to the off side.

Tanvir is making the ball talk in Greek and Latin to the Lankan batsmen. Chamara is beaten outside off yet again, hanging his bat away from the body after making an apology of a forward press. The ball seams away splendidly late and misses the edge.
squared up again, he edges it into the cordon now as Tanvir seams another one away.

and an unintended edge to finish the sequence. Chamara came forward, he was searching for the ball and then wanted to drag his bat out of the stroke, but the ball found it and took the edge to roll past the slips.

boy, Tanvir is looking as unplayable as he was in IPL 2008. This one curled in so much, it forced Sanga to check his cut and convert it into a drive, before checking the drive and converting it into a defensive push, as it kept coming in towards the pads.
goes the other way now, Sanga is watchful and spots the movement just in time.
too full and too straight, worked square for a single.
not the best of starts. Over-pitched outside off to the master, and Sanga says thank you as he eases into a comprehensive cover drive.
shortens the length and produces the edge immediately. Junaid gets it to straighten after angling in towards off stump and Sanga steers the edge to third man. Ajmal does extremely well to save four.
gorgeous from Sanga! Carbon copy of the first ball, except that Sanga managed to make the cover drive look even more beautiful this time. Class act, as Rameez would say.
too short and angling towards the hips, Sanga nudges behind square for a single.

Chamara's not made much of an impact after flying into the UAE. Junaid strikes in his first over, with a 139 kph delivery that did little off the pitch. It angled across Chamara at pace, landing outside off and inviting the drive. Chamara gladly obliged, providing Misbah with some more slip catching practice. Disaster for the Lankans.
and Junaid nearly slips one through him. Angled across, landing on middle and straightening, Mathews gets the front pad across and only just manages to defend to the leg side.
Sanga continues to roll. On his pads, he shuffles into the line and helps the straying Tanvir down to fine leg for four.
Sanga is doing this all by himself. Another one over-pitched outside off, Sanga walks into the cover drive and picks up four more.
back of a length this time, defended to the off side.
big wide down the leg side, and really impressive take from Umar who leaps across.

Sanga is going after him, getting as many runs as he can before his team-mates gift their wickets away. Short ball outside off, he stands tall beside the line and veritably smacks it up and over backward point.
back of a length and angling in, Sanga covers the line and defends.
darted into the pads at 122 kph - his pace is not his strength - Sanga dabs it along to deep backward square leg for one.
Junaid swings this in at 139 kph, Sanga gets forward and push-drives to mid-on for a quick single.
another edge into the slips, but this doesn't carry to Younis at second slip. Angelo did well to at least proffer soft hands as the ball shaped across the bat face to take an outside edge.
buzzes outside off at 139 kph, and Sanga leaves. Afridi looks fidgety. He's worried he won't have any wickets to take, at this rate?
Sanga stays on the crease and guides a short ball to point. Misfield by Prof. Hafeez at point allows the single.
Angelo whips after getting the front foot well across. Single wide of mid-on.
bouncer at 142 kph, from that lovely open-chested action of Junaid's - doesn't seem to take anything out of him to bowl this fast. Sanga ducks under it in a hurry.
tossed up and turning in, Mathews leans out to defend to the leg side.
again, Mathews tries to cover the line and defend.
Ajmal slips it down the leg side, and Umar hops across with exemplary anticipation to stop it.
loopy ball, defended off the front foot.
leans out to reach the flight and defend with soft hands.
doosra now, straightens from a full length outside off, and Mathews plays it down the track.
another doozie to end the over, Mathews was on the front foot and played it with the spin into the off side. Drinks in Abu Dhabi, and Sri Lanka can do with a break.
short of a length on the pads, worked with the angle to midwicket.
back of a length outside off, Sanga stays still and redirects it through point for another single
Mathews stays put on the crease and defends a length ball to the off side of the pitch.
Angelo is squared up yet again! Full ball, snips across off the seam and Mathews does well to adjust and defend.
short of a length on middle and leg, defended from the crease.
Mathews gets one on the pads, and works it from the crease to midwicket.
length ball on the off stump, defended to the on side off the inside half of the bat.
short ball, turning away and it is cut away through point.
Mathews defends a length ball breaking in to the on side.
on the pads now, Sanga nudges it square to the leg side.
flighted on off stump, Sanga leans out to defend.
full ball on off stump, straightens and Mathews defends cautiously.
short ball on the middle and leg line, Mathews works it around the corner for one.
Afridi gives Sanga a full toss outside off, and it is duly crashed to the cover boundary. Well played, Sanga.
89 kph, flat and quick, Sanga stays back and dabs it square.
full ball on off stump, defended off the front foot.
gets the single this time, pushes into the covers off the front foot.
Mathews gets inside the line and works Ajmal to the leg side.
doosra, Mathews leans out and covers the line as it goes away. Defended to the off side.
very full, Mathews gets forward and drives to long-on for one.
Ajmla strays down the leg side, Sanga glances very daintily and the ball shoots down to fine leg for four. The man in the deep was very square, and Misbah isn't pleased at all with the effort.
short of a length, Sanga hands back and pushes to midwicket.
drift for Afridi, comes in towards middle and leg, and straightens. Defended off the front foot.
back of a length outside off, Mathews defends to the off side.
leans out and defends with the turn into the off side for one.
too short and sliding across Sanga, who forces it into the covers.
another short ball, Sanga cuts it through point for a single.
short ball, hurtles through at some pace and Mathews dead-bats from the crease.
loopy ball outside off, Sanga leans out to defend to the off side.
Sanga opens the wrists this time and works it into the covers.
again flighted outside off and spinning away, played with the turn to mid-off.
the doosra, Sanga has enough time to spot it and go back to defend, since it is too short.
straightens the offie from middle stump, and Sanga defends it down the track.
maiden for Ajmal, 91 kph offbreak, Sanga defends sedately. They really need to find another name for these bowling "Powerplays"
good stroke from Mathews, a rare touch of confidence as he gets forward and drives with the turn down the ground. In the air, and done in style.
shortens the length, Mathews adjusts as it straightens and defends to the off side.
tossed up to Sanga, Afridi is looking for that leggie that breaks in through the gap, but this time Sanga drives compactly. If only he had done so the other night ...
Mathews drives with the turn into the covers.
on the pads to end the over, Sanga defends with the wrists to midwicket.
tossed up and straightens from off stump, Sanga defends off the front foot.
short ball, Sanga looks to drive a single through mid-off, but cover comes in the way.
back of a length, Sanga pushes a single down to long-on to bring up a high-quality 50 under immense pressure.
tossed up from over the stumps, Mathews pushes it past Hafeez and gets a single. Should have been stopped.
flighted on off stump, Sanga defends off the front foot.
too straight now, Sanga pushes it through mid-on for one more.
angled across Sanga at good pace and he lets it go.
keeps it back of a length again, Sanga defends to the off side.
back of a length outside off, Sanga pushes into the covers for a quick single. The 50-run stand is up.

yowza, Mathews hits back with a vengeance. Jumps out out the crease, gets the momentum going into a straight hoick and goes through with the shot despite not getting close to the pitch. Typical Angelo.
Gul replies with a short ball, Mathews adjusts well and plays a controlled pull down to backward square leg.
Sanga lets the final ball go through, it angles across him at good pace
flighted on off stump, Mathews drives back to Hafeez. Sanga is in the way and it hits his pad and deviates. They take the single.  What are the chances he'll win a fairplay award this year?
tossed up, Sanga drives with the turn to cover.
gets the single this time, driving to long off.
worked with the turn to midwicket as Hafeez slows this one through the air.
short and flatter, Mathews dabs it behind square for a single.
drifts in towards the pads, Sanga pushes it with the angle through midwicket.
short of a length on the pads, worked with the angle to midwicket for a couple.
short of a length on off stump, Mathews moves across and defends cautiously.
nearly squared up, but well played in the end. One of those Gul legcutters, doesn't quite bounce off a length, but has him in a knot all the same. Mathews covers the line from the crease.

Angelo goes downtown, and takes his car for a spin on the Sheikh Zayed Road. This is top-class straight hitting. Down the track, not to the length, and he just heaves through the line. Clean and simple, all the way over long-off for a biggie.
back of a length outside off, Mathews lets Umar Akmal take it.
loopy ball on off stump, driven into the covers.
short ball, this time he gets the single through the covers.
Mathews leans out and defends off the front foot down the track.
back of a length, driven from the crease down to mid-on.
pushed back again, Mathews works it to midwicket now.
speared onto the pads, Mathews turns it round the corner for a single.
loopy ball outside off, 82 kph and Mathews works it to midwicket.
fuller on middle and leg, played to mid-on off the toes
gets to the flight this time and drives down the ground for one.
turn away from outside off, Sanga defends into the covers and gets a single.
Mathews gets the front foot across and dinks with the turn to square leg. Can't get the single now.
this time he does, punched solidly to long-on with the turn.
good work from Misbah at midwicket, intercepts the back foot push to cut off the single.
Mathews adjusts and dabs against the spin through backward point for one.
now Afridi misfields at midwicket, gifting Sanga a single as he works a full ball against the turn.
extra bounce on this one as it turns down the leg side, Mathews plays it uppishly to square leg.
slides down leg side and it is a wide. Umar Akmal can't stop it.
full ball on off stump, driven down to long-off for a single.
Mathews turns one with the spin towards square leg.
tossed up outside off, Sanga defends with an angled face towards point.
whoa, that one spun extra and zipped down the leg, just past leg stump. Very harsh wide call from Erasmus.
not so harsh this time. Big wide down the leg side.
breaking in from outside off, Mathews defends off the front foot.
works it with the turn this time, through midwicket.
beaten outside off by the turn. Sanga's been batting in full control for a while, but suddenly Malik breaks one across the face of the blade.
this one comes in with the arm, Sanga stays back and plays it down the track.
round-armish from round the stumps, Sanga eases it through cover-point for one.
Hafeez loops this up on off stump, and Sanga plays it back to the bowler.
armer from Hafeez, hurries in as Sanga plays for the spin... Inside edge onto the boot.
gets the middle of the bat this time, driven with the turn into the covers and he hares back for two.
turning away from the line of off stump, Sanga guides it into the point region for one.
back of a length, Mathews stays on the crease and punches down the track.
slips down the leg side, Mathews glides it down to fine-leg for a couple of runs.
Sanga goes over the top, chipped in the air intentionally with the spin, but it went off the toe of the bat so he couldn't get four for it.
fuller, Sanga gets to the flight and pushes softly into the covers for one.
Mathews works it with the spin to the leg side.
aah, Mathews gets across to an offbreak and nearly gets bowled round the legs. The ball brushes his thigh on the way, else the stumps were in its sights.
turns in from outside off, Mathews stays beside the line and defends to point.
eases the front pad across and works the ball to midwicket.
Hafeez plugs away round the stumps, Sanga works a single towards midwicket.
floater outside off, Mathews spots it and guides it towards point for a quick single.
uppish but safe. Hafeez slows it up, Sanga is lulled into an early drive and nearly pops it to cover.
shorter ball, Sanga hangs back and forces a single into the covers.
Mathews leans out and defends one that turns in, resolutely.
floater outside off, Mathews adjusts and steers it to point.
short ball to Sanga, he cuts it to deep cover for one.
zonkers! Afridi gets this ball to veer away madly after dipping in, and Mathews does everything except edge it after leaning out.
too short now, Mathews hacks it into the covers for a couple.
the googly that hurtles in off the turf, Mathews is cramped but manages to get some inside edge on it.
back of a length, Sanga stays on the crease and guides it through wide mid-on.
full ball straightens from off stump, Sanga plays it back to the bowler.
turns away outside off, Sanga guides with the spin to point.
on the pads, too full for Sanga to time the drive well.
played off the toes to mid-on once again.
gets the single eventually, the 100th run of this stand. Sanga turns the wrists on a full ball on his toes and gets away.
slider to end the over, outside off, and Mathews adjusts to defend with opened face.
tossed up outside off, defended with the turn to the off side.
on the pads this time, worked to midwicket for a single.
over-pitched outside off, Sanga laces it through the covers for a single.
quick one that zips outside off, Mathews calmly pats into the covers for a single.
on Sanga's pads, he tucks it through square leg for one more.
very full to Mathews who defends.
flat ball from round the stumps, Sanga works it to midwicket for a single.
doosra that breaks away from Mathews, who pushes it from the crease into the covers.
keeps it back of a length once more, Sanga works it to long-on for one more.
straightens from middle and leg, no room for Mathews to use. He defends it.
doosra that slides across, Mathews drops it to point and hares across. Gul was on his heels there.
looped up outside off and straightening, Sanga eases it through point for one more.
another one speared in flat, Sanga works it through midwicket for a single.
spins down the line, Mathews plays around the pad and misses. Hmm, he was hit in front of off. Not the biggest appeal, and it was turned down.
Sanga gets the single now, worked through midwicket.
full ball on the middle and leg line, Mathews punches to long-on for one more.
two PP overs gone quietly. Sanga can't get to the pitch and defends to the off side as the ball spins away.
tossed up on the stumps, Mathews defends it back down the track.
doosra, Mathews adjusts and guides to point.
flighted on off and middle now, another ball goes unused. Half the PP gone now.
short ball, Mathews pushes it into the covers.
another flat ball, Mathews stays on strike as he plays to cover.
finally a run. Mathews lets the floater slide off the face of his bat towards short third man for one.
tossed up outside off and turning into Mathews, who quietly defends to midwicket.
Mathews gets to his fifty at long last. Works a single backward of square leg.
leading edge, but Sanga is safe as he chips out and looks to flick. The ball goes well over mid-off.
Mathews turns it over with another single.

the big stand is broken. Sanga muscles a flighted ball straight to Misbah at cover. It has been a really good innings, and in the circumstances a solid stand, but Sanga will know his business wasn't finished. Hafeez continues to pick up crucial wickets with uncanny ease.
tossed up and spinning away, Jeevan defends with the turn to point.
full ball from round the stumps, Mathews leans out to defend.
tossed up on the pads, Mathews works it through square leg for a single. SL are sputtering away through these Powerplay overs.
85 kph, doosra drifts into the pads, Jeevan seemed to spot it late and inner edged it to square leg for one.
Mathews breaks the shackles, the skip out and a straight hit. He inside-outed the shot a touch through wide mid-off. Gul was loping at mid-off to have any chance of catching it.
full ball on the pads, worked off the inner edge through square leg.
another ball defended to end the Powerplay. 20 for 1, SL made in that phase.
tossed up and turning away, defended to the off side.
tossed up wide of off stump, Mendis skips out and drives into the covers.
back of a length, Mathews hangs back and forces it into the covers.
Jeevan steers from outside off and gets a very quick single to point.. Risky, but well run.
legbreak straightens down the line, Mathews defends it.
hmm, slips past the outside edge at pace, Mathews tries to angle it away but misses.
offbreak that stops on Jeevan, who adjusts and defends to the off side.
armer outside off, Jeevan is cramped for room but tries to cut. He can't find point.
fuller ball outside off, Jeevan leans out and defends to the off side.
tossed up once again, even slower and Jeevan eases it to cover as it dips.
The Professor bowls a maiden over. Another loopy dipping offbreak, defended to the off side once again.

Afridi has a wicket, and he doesn't even celebrate in usual style. It is the quick fast ball that angles across the left hander. Jeevan is sucked into the trap, he leans out and searches for the drive, but the ball misses the edge. And then, for some reason, Jeevan takes his back foot out of the crease as he over-balances, and then comically falls down three yards out of the crease. Umar fumbles the ball, but has all the time to break the stumps.
full ball angled across the left-hander, who drives into the covers.
Mathews gets another single, pushing Afridi with the spin through cover.
Thisara gets a full ball on middle and off, and squeezes it out to point.
sliding down the leg side, Mathews gets it away backward of square leg for one.

heartbreak for Sri Lanka. Mathews plays around a straight one and is bowled round the legs. Offbreak angled in from round the stumps, lands on leg stump and straightens. Mathews had walked too far across and was looking to work it square. Mistake. Leg stump comes in the ball's way.
doosra to the new man, beats the outside edge now. Seekkuge keeps seeking the ball, but it misses the edge and zips into the keeper's gloves.
full ball on the middle and leg line, defended to the leg side.
another doosra, even fuller, even zippier and Prasanna has no clue what to do with it.
flatter and straighter, defended with the turn to the leg side.
rapped on the pads by yet another doosra! He keeps beating him if he lands them on middle and off, and he can't get the lbw if he goes straighter, since this landed outside leg.
Thisara tries to guide an Afridi googly to third man, and misses.
another wrong 'un, lands outside leg and comes onto the pads. Thisara nudges it behind square.
the Afridi medium-pacer hurtles in, and Seekkuge defends from the crease.
slow loopy legbreak, this time Prasanna gets the front pad across and works it square.
another googly outside leg, Thisara nudges it daintily down to fine leg for a couple
short and wide, turning away from Thisara and he misses an ambitious cut.
fuller ball on the pads, Thisara muscles it down to wide long-on for a couple.
flat offbreak outside off, turning in from outside off, Prasanna can't time the cut.
doosra makes a complete bunny out of him! Prasanna tries to play the offbreak to midwicket, but this one goes away drastically and leaves him beaten all ends up.
fuller ball, Prasanna gets under it and drives over wide mid-on for a couple.
getting better for Pras, he picks a doozie at long last and steers it backward of point for a single.
whoa, Thisara nearly perishes to one that angles in and holds its line outside off. Close to the edge, close to the stump ...
loopy leggie straightens from middle stump line, and Prasanna dabs it to midwicket for one.
googly goes away, Thisara just lottery-slashes it and scoops it off the toe of the bat over backward point. Stunning running, gets them three.
short ball breaks in from outside off, Prasanna tries to pull but the ball is through him.
short ball outside off, Thisara hacks it into the cover-point area.
98 kph, full ball outside off, Prasanna drives hard but straight to cover.
breaking away from outside off, Prasanna adjusts and defends to point.
short ball from Ajmal outside off, Thisara cuts straight to point.
full ball on the stumps, Thisara slugs it away through mid-on for a single. Not a ball has been timed since the 40th over.
another doosra, Prasanna has done everything except edge one of these.
wide, juicy offbreak, another heave another miss from Prasanna.
tossed up on the stumps, Prasanna hauls it without timing to long-on for a single.
Thisara mistimes a slog now and they get a laboured single to long-on for his efforts.
wide of off stump from Afridi, Prasanna cracks a single to deep point.
loopy, drifting legbreak in the slot, Prasanna tries to smash him through midwicket, but bottom-edges it to the deep for only a single.
short ball, quick and cramping, Thisara drags it away to midwicket for a couple.

hideous effort from Tanvir and Shafiq converging on a skier. Thisara looks to slog Afridi across the line, the hand comes off the grip and it goes miles high. When it comes down, the afore-said men dawdle around towards it without putting in an effort to take the catch.
Prasanna scratches a single into the off side.

this time, Thisara connects and he has smashed the ball towards Lulu Hypermart in Dubai. Quick offcutter, there for the slog-sweep and Thisara veritably climbed into it. The ball made a cork-popping noise as he connected. Humongous.
slow leg-cutting loopy one bowled short of a length outside off and comes so slowly to miss the attempted cut, and the stumps.
quicker this time, Prasanna is beaten for pace but gets a leg-bye into the off side.
wide yorker outside off to Thisara from over the stumps. He backs away, but can't lay bat on it.

slower ball at 105 kph. Thisara could have gone to the dressing room and come back to play it. But he didn't, he tried his best to adjust and swat it away, but the ball still hoodwinked him and took out leg stump.
another slow ball, lands in Malinga's slot outside off as he chips out, and crashes it through the covers. A rare bit of muscle in the end overs.

and he finishes with a wicket. Well bowled, Tanvir. Another slower ball, this was short and hence Malinga couldn't play the big heave down the ground. He ended up having to drag it away to the leg side, but he mistimed it. Misbah ran in to take a good low catch.

inn2.comm: and Hafeez promptly puts him away for four. Fast, but too full and on the pads. Hafeez clips him away fluently through square leg.
better length, holds it back and Hafeez stays on the crease to defend.
lets this one go outside off, Hafeez pushes the front foot across and leaves. Nice pace from Mali.
gets behind a length ball and defends.
good leave outside off as Malinga gets it to dart away marginally from off stump.
ends with one back of a length outside off, Hafeez covers the line and defends.
Thisara starts off with a really wide ball outside off, and it swings away even more. The keeper can't stop it.
back of a length outside off, Shafiq gets a thick, but controlled, outside edge down to third man for a couple.
good carry, this pitch has not eased up at all. He lets it go to the keeper.
ah, Thisara sprays this onto the pads and Shafiq whips him away over midwicket for three.
over-pitched, this isn't very good bowling. Hafeez quickly arrests the forward press and whips away easily through midwicket for four.
gets the right length this time outside off, Hafeez lets it go.
ends with one that jumps up from back of a length, Hafeez shoulders arms.
140 kph on the perfect length outside off, and Shafiq defends confidently off the front foot.
buzzes away off a length outside off, Shafiq defends with an angled face towards point.
away seam movement from outside off, another confident leave.
Shafiq gets the front foot across and leaves another one outside off.
slower ball, full offcutter on off stump, Shafiq spots it and defends off the front foot.
whoa, beaten outside off by the away seam. Shafiq has a half-hearted prod but can't get bat on it.
back of a length from Thisara, hits the seam and gets it to go away, but not straight enough to make him play.
offcutter, cuts Hafeez up as he tries to get across. He was attempting to arrest the forward press and defend, but the ball beat the bat to thud into his thigh.
defends a length ball from the crease to the off side.
on a length once again, wider outside off and Hafeez lets it go.
lovely shot, but well fielder at point. 135 kph and short, not really wide, but Hafeez jumps and cracks it square. Dilshan does really well at point.
fuller length at 130 kph, Hafeez leans out to play it to cover.
back of a length and extra bounce on that effort ball, Shafiq doesn't play at it.
bumper at 142 kph, Shafiq saw it early and seemed set to rock back and play the pyull, but wisely just ducked under it.
slower ball at 129 kph - that's faster than Tanvir's fastest ball - Shafiq is draw out to drive to mid off.
another good bouncer in excess of 141 kph, and Shafiq is organised enough to duck under it.
another short one, 142 kph and Shafiq ducks under it again.
No run scored for 20 balls. Shafiq holds the bat inside the line as Malinga slings down a pacy delivery that fairly thuds into Sanga's gloves.
Thisara bowls a length ball wide of off stump, Hafeez shoulders arms.
back of a length again, Hafeez stays on the crease and shoulders arms.
gets closer to off stump, Hafeez is still not tempted into playing it.
short of a length, Hafeez plays that leap and cut shot again, this time Jeevan does brilliantly at cover to stop and shy at the stumps. But they get the single by then.
Shafiq presses forward and check-drives into the covers with nice timing, but can't find the gap.
top shot. Gets a sliver of room outside off, and he stands back and waits for it to arrive beside him before easing it behind point for a couple. Dilhara does well at third man to stop the boundary.
tossed up outside off, driven through Dilshan who gets a bad bounce at short cover.
googly spins down the leg side, and it is worked round the corner for three more runs.
loopy legbreak, drifts in and straightens. Defended off the front foot.
on the pads, Shafiq works it square for a single.
wrong 'un, slides in fron back of a length, and Hafeez defends from the crease.
back of a length on the stumps, driven down to long-on for a single.
back of a length outside off, looked like Hafeez didn't see that ball as he adjusted late and defended down the track. Some distrurbance behind the bowler's arm. Sorted now.
short length ball again outside off, not enough room for the driving, so Hafeez eases it to point.
131 kph short ball, Hafeez drives into the covers from the crease.
Hafeez camps back on the crease again and defends down the track.
width this time at 132 kph, Hafeez guides it with the pace of the ball to third man for a single.
away swinger from Perera, but too wide to trouble Shafiq. Another leave. Sedate stuff, this.

boy, he's struck again with the first ball of a new spell. Whippy, back of a length ball that goes away just a touch and bounces, Hafeez cuts from it miles away from the body and edges to the right of Sanga. Easy take for him.
back of a length outside off, Younis gets across and lets it go.
fuller this time, at 138 kph, Younis stays on the crease as he defends to the off side.
shortens the length, Younis hops on the crease and keeps it down to the off side.
keeps it short again, Younis opens the face and defends with the angle towards point. This is a good over.
139.5 kph, and on a driving length, Younis is away with a check drive wide of mid-off.
starts with a gentle away seamer on a length, Younis stays on the crease and defends to the off side.
not at Malinga's full pace yet, short of a length and Younis defends to the off side again.
136 kph and it moves away off the seam, Younis guides it down to third man for a single.
banged away, boy what a sumtupous stroke! Shafiq gets a ball back of a length outside off, he gets the front foot out and laces it square. For a brief instant he looked like Ponting there.
inside edged onto the pad. Full ball on off stump, and it shapes in. Shafiq was a little loose, and playing around the pads to the leg side. Lucky to get an edge, that would have been plumb.
134 kph, full length ball on off stump. Shafiq defends off the front foot down the track.
slower ball, the split finger Dilhara variety at 123 kph. Younis defends cautiously.
short of a length outside off, defends from the crease to the off side.
short ball at 142 kph, but Younis is a class act, as Rameez would say. He hops across, gets behind the line and pulls it through square leg for three.
bouncer outside Shafiq's off stump and he ducks with a flourish.
and again, that's really short, it goes out of the camera frame and Shafiq bends backwards like Keanu Reeves dodging bullets.
hat-trick. 143 kph and this time angling in. Not sure why Erasmus isn't counting these bouncers. Anyway, Shafiq ducks under it again, this time bending forward.
short, wide down the leg side and called a wide.
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn through mid-off.
over-pitched outside off, driven through point for a single.
short of a length, hacked into the covers by Younis for one more.

whoa, Shafiq jumps out and gives it a dose of Afridi. Not close to the pitch, in fact he went the other way to create more room and heaved through the line. It buzzed past the bowler before he could get his hands behind it.
tossed up slower, Shafiq caresses it into the covers for one more.
breaking away from off stump, Younis adjusts and defends.
Dilhara goes too short and too wide. Another wide .
back of a length on off stump, defended from the crease.
bouncer at 140 kph, Shafiq ducks under it again. Surprise, surprise! Umpire Erasmus has called it a bouncer.
well played Shafiq. So many short balls, this fuller one was coming. And Shafiq was ready, he drilled it right back past the bowler. Mid-off isn't at the usual position and it bounds away.
played in the air through gully, but he found the gap well. Short ball outside off, Shafiq goes at it with hard hands without rising with the bounce. Not in control at all ...
back of a length outside off, too close to cut and Shafiq lets it go.
fuller length outside off, driven straight to cover.
116 kph, this is a friendly trundle. Defended to mid-on off the front foot.
back of a length and nipping into the pads, worked to square leg.
legcutter at 118 kph, Shafiq presses forward and feels for it ... Close to the edge.

Given lbw, and he's referred it. Well bowled Angelo, gets this one to come in off the seam after taking the previous one away. Shafiq gets the front foot too far across and then scissors the bat down around it, but the ball slips through and hits him dead plub. Three reds light up.
full length ball outside off, Misbah doesn't move the feet anywhere. He just shouldered arms with minimal effort.
fuller ball, makes Misbah play with his languid forward lunge. It goes off the outside edge behind point.
back of a length outside off, Misbah stands back in the crease and defends to the off side.
whoa, nice bustling short ball, Misbah hops and tries to ride the bounce, but ends up splicing it down past the cordon.
short ball at 134 kph, Younis stays back and defends.
short again at 139 kph, Younis hangs back and defends to the covers.
back of a length outside off, Younis stays on the crease and defends.
too short, Younis is up to the task of climbing on it and rolling the wrists on a controlled pull through square leg.
Angelo pitches this up and Misbah drives in along the ground to mid-off.
back of a length outside off, Misbah lets it go from the crease.
this one nips in from the seam, Misbah manages to play it to the leg side, unlike Shafiq who got knotted up.
stays back and defends a length ball into the off side.
Misbah has lofted the ball! More than a foot off the turf. In fact, its a lovely shot. Length ball on off stump and he golf-swings it over mid-off for four.

dropped! Jeevan has given Misbah a jeevan. Short ball outside off, cut uppishly. It was dying on Jeevan, but he should have held it. Dilshan looks like a man who has the fates and the weather conspiring against him.

scoops a slower ball in the air, but escapes! This is exactly the ball Dilhara used to get Younis last time. On this occasion, Younis opens the face and scoops it over gully instead of towards mid-off. That saved him.
Misbah gets forward and defends to the off side.
short of a length, defended from the crease to the off side.
short ball angled in towards the body, Misbah rolls the wrists on the pull and gets a couple to deep square leg.
full length ball on off stump, Misbah gets forward and defends to the off side.
144 kph on the bouncer, slips down the leg side and it is called wide.
stays behind the line and defends a short ball to the off side.
Mathews delivers on a length, and it is defended off the front foot to the off side.
angled in towards the pads, worked with the angle through square leg for a single.
another length ball angles in, it is driven down to long-on for one more.
Younis hangs back and opens the face to steer a length ball towards point.
length ball outside off, Misbah lets it go.
length fare to end the over too, Misbah gets well across to steer it to the off side.
inside edge onto the pad. Younis looks to plant the front foot forward and drive through the line, but Thisara bends this in. It nearly sneaks through.
another one ducks in, worked with the angle through square leg.
Misbah blazes this one away. Short and wide of off stump, he carves it away with power and grace through the covers. Zero-risk shot.
fuller, slower and more importantly, straighter. Misbah gets the front foot across and defends.
extra bounce outside off, Misbah rides it and guides cautiously between slip and gully.
finishes the over with one in the corridor outside off. Misbah leaves.
115 kph on that slower ball, Younis nudges it off the pads to midwicket.
attacks the pads, but too straight. Younis whips it away square for a couple.
beaten by the pace outside off. Short of a length, it fairly whistles off the turf as Misbah attempts a rather daring steer. Play and a miss.
wider, he again goes for the shot and misses the cut. 138 kph, he was beaten by the pace.
back of a length outside off, Misbah hangs on the back foot and connects with the cut to point.
full ball on the pads, 136 kph and worked through square leg for a single.
short ball turning away, worked against the turn to midwicket.
turning away outside off, played from the crease into the covers.
tossed up slowly, Younis works it to midwicket for one.
strays onto the leg stump, worked to the square leg area for one.
googly comes in sharp from outside off, but Younis picks it and gets a single through square leg.
too short, Misbah rocks back and milks a single to long-on.
short ball straightens from middle and leg, and Misbah gets another single through midwicket.
wide slips down the leg side.
pitches outside leg and spins in, Younis misses the sweep and is hit on the pad, but that can't be lbw.
back of a length, worked away square.
lovely little stroke, tossed up and breaking away and Younis inside-outs it majestically. Boy, I can watch that replay a few times to keep me inspired.
full ball outside off, Younis drives down to long-off for another single.,
breaking in from outside off, forced into the covers for one.
fuller this time, driven against the turn into the covers again.
loopy on the pads, whipped with the turn through midwicket
turning into the pads, Misbah works it behind square for a single.
this one spins in, Misbah leans out and defends off the inner half of the bat.
very full, Misbah manages to get some leverage on the on-drive and gets a single.
whoa, Misbah pulls out the reverse sweep. Jeevan gives him a full toss and the captain gladly swats it past short third man.
flighted ball on off stump, Misbah leans out and defends with bat and pad close together.
googly comes in, Misbah covers the line and defends.
77 kph on a short legging that turns away, Younis cuts it square for a single.
prods for another short leggie that lands wide. Lucky to get away with it..
too full, Younis couldn't get under the drive since he was too close to it and gets a single through cover-point.
tossed up outside off, Younis works it square for one more.
wide slips down the leg side.
tossed up outside off, worked with the turn through long-on.
Misbah crouches across and nudges with the turn through square leg.
short ball on Younis' pads, he whips it through midwicket for one more.

this Misbah reverse sweep is a thing of beauty! He picks the right ball, ones that are very full and just slaps them tamely, very fine. Sanga jumped away to try and gets this on reflex, but it sped past, and even short third man couldn't stop it.
Younis works a couple through square leg for a couple.

pinned on the crease, and Younis has to go. Jeevan slips in a quick and sprightly legbreak that lands on off and straightens. Younis should have probably played forward to it. He looked to work it to the leg side across the line and the ball hit him at shin height, and seemed set to crash into off stump.

on a hat-trick! Jeevan has breathed some jeevan into the innings now. Malik gropes in hope is trapped palpably in front. The last one was the leggie, this was the googly. Malik's turn to be caught on the crease, he didn't spot the turn and was playing down the long line. He's not looked the part at all with the bat in these two innings. Plumb.
Akmal, you legend. He skips out of the crease and drives with the turn to mid-off.
another googly, goes off the inside edge to the square leg area.
ah, he drops this short and Akmal pulls it away through midwicket for four.
back of a length outside off, defended from the crease.
legcutter, Misbah spots oit late and adjusts in a hurry to defend it to the off side.
another legcutter, at a very gentle pace. Misbah is conscious to come out of the crease and get closer to the pitch, but still struggles to handle it.
118 kph, length fare a couple of yards outside off. Misbah leaves.
back of a length outside off, Misbah defends to the off side. Maiden over.
whoa, Umar packs a punch here. Gets down the track and carves a full ball into the covers.
76 kph, straightens down the line as Misbah stays back and just about spots the line and defends.
legbreak straightens again, Misbah cautiously blocks.
onto the pads, worked backward of square leg for a single.
beats Umar outside off with a quick leggie now. This is a fine spell.
over-pitched googly now, Umar skips out and gets close to the pitch to work it from middle and leg line to the leg side.
short ball, gets good lift though he's isn't really bustling through the crease. Umar defends.
full ball outside off, Umar drives straight to cover.
full length to Umar, he again punches prodigiously to cover.
short of a length, allows Umar to go back and punch down to long-on for one.
too wide to Misbah, he hangs back and cuts it square for a single.
full length ball outside off to end the over, Umar defends off the front foot.

that's Misbah's third reverse sweep and it is again completely risk-free and gets him four. This time, the cause is helped by a disastrous effort from Thisara Perera at short third man. Straight through him.
dips and drifts onto the pads, Misbah drives through mid-on for one.
tossed up, Jeevan jumps out to the flight and drives through mid-off for another single.
big legbreak away from Misbah, and he lets it go.
tossed up on the stumps, Misbah plants it down the ground for one more.
short ball to end the over, and Umar cuts it to deep point for another single.
lovely ball, drift and turn from leg stump across the face of a fidgetty Umar, and it takes the outside edge to run away fine.
ah, a sight for sore eyes! Misbah pulls out that big forward lunge and kills the ball. The ball just evaporates in the face of this defensive.
flighted on off stump, driven to mid-off.
again, lunges some five yards out and grinds the bowling to dust.
tlopns the face now and steers towards point.
great finish to the over, subtly faster at 82 kph and Misbah hangs back and only just manages to stab it away.
humongous spin away from the off stump, Umar goes for a mad spin away from the body and misses.
Sanga appeals so hard for the lbw, that he forgets to go for the run out. Googly lands on off and turns in, surely sliding down the leg side. The ball goes to the leg side and they pinch a legbye.
short ball, thumped away through midwicket off the backfoot.
slow and loopy, driven with the turn through the covers.

another reverse sweep attempted! This is the theatre of the comical now! Sanga goes away to the off side anticipating the shot, but Misbah chooses this time of all to miss the shot. The ball goes where Sanga originally was standing. That was straight out of Just for Laughs - Gags!
tossed up, driven with the turn through mid-off.
Misbah moves to the leg side and comes back to fool around with the bowler, but Prasanna keeps it outside off. Played to the off side.
again, goes away and comes back in line to defend a googly off the inner half.
gets the sweep into play now, keeps it down and gets it to deep square leg for two.
tossed up on off and middle, Misbah presses forward and defends.
straighter one, skids along as Misbah stays on the crease and works it behind square.
full length ball to start his action, defended off the front foot.
back of a length outside off, Umar cracks a square cut for one.
short and wide to Misbah, who opens the face and dabs it square.
back of a length, Umar forces another single into the covers.
back of a length outside off, Misbah opens the face and guides it behind square for one.
polite little indipper, Umar gets inside the line and works it assiduously through midwicket for one.
speared onto the pads, Umar is fidgety stikll and works it to the leg side.
gets well forward and defends a flighted ball down the track.
skips out to the flight and drives with the turn through mid-off for one.
short ball, Misbah cuts it from the middle and leg line through backward point.
tossed up and turning away, defended with an opened face to the off side.
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn down to long-off.
whoa, lovely offcutter, Misbah is hit on the back foot, but the ball's bounced too much and struck him well above the pad as he shuffled across and tried to bring the bat back in to cover the line.
back of a length outside off, Umar chips out and looks to force through point.
full length outside off, steered towards point.
full and angling in, Umar gets the front foot inside the line and beavers it through midwicket. Misbah charges back for the second.
imperious from Umar. Backs away, gets a full ball in the slot and hoists it up and over cover. Such smooth flow in that stroke.
slower ball on middle and off, Umar again moves to the off side, and plays to the off side.
Brigadier Block has reached his 50. Short ball outside off, cut away to deep point and he soldiers on. I don't know about you guys, I am a huge fan of this man..
Umar gets width now, and he's enjoying the Powerplay. Slower ball, just outside off, Umar waits and dabs it late through third man for four.
short and wide outside off, this time he has to leap to reach it and cut it square for one more.
very wide yorker at 136 kph, Misbah digs it out to the off side.
Lasith swings this one too far down the leg side and it is another run to the cause.
full ball on the pads, Misbah on-drives a single to long-on.
Umar crouches and rises with an over-pitched ball outside off, and gets a single through point.
his first-ball of new spell reputation is so famous, even Umar defends carefully down the track.
short ball, Umar hops across and opens the face to defend it to the off side.
angled into the pads, Umar stays on the crease and nudges with the angle through square leg.
full length on 134 kph, Misbah nurdles it through midwicket for a single.
Fernando makes some five appeals for an lbw, and then chooses not to review it when it is turned down. Offcutter, surely heading down the leg side as Misbah misses the turn off the pads.
this time he stays back and taps to the leg side for a single.
full length ball wide of off stump, Misbah steers it to point.
back of a length, Misbah stays on the crease and defends to the off side.
slower ball from Lasith, Misbah spots it just in time and defends to the leg side.
ahem, full ball, Misbah drives it back and Malinga gets a boot on it towards mid-on. Misbah runs halfway down and then goes back.
too short, pulled to square leg for a single.
short ball outside off, Misbah watches closely and leaves.
back of a length and outside off, Misbah guides it behind square for a single.
short ball outside off, Umar jumps to reach the bounce and cuts but can't time of place it.
low full toss - never the easiest to time. Umar manages to heave it over the bowler's head and safely past mid-off for a couple.
short ball, sits up for the slap and Umar indulges himself with a powerful swat through midwicket. Pakistan in line for 4-1 here.
Misbah just tortures him with that front-foot defence. Boy, got to love him!
short googly comes in, hacked into the covers for a single.
Umar skips out to the flight and gets too close. Driven without timing to mid-off.
tossed up on off and middle, defended off the front foot.
squeezed onto the pads, on-driven for a single through wide mid-on.
short ball outside off, Misbah stays back and pushes a single to long-on.
full ball outside off, Misbah guides it into the covers.
a hint of away seam at 121 kph, Misbah gets an outside edge on the booming drive and it goes behind point.
short ball outside off, Misbah plays the pull down through wide mid-on.
back of a length at 139 kph, Umar guides it away behind square for a single.
Dilhara cramps Umar as he backs away and lands a length ball on middle. Umar tries to dab it square and gets an inside edge.
short ball, Umar hops inside the line and drops it to the leg side.
Umar skips out to a full toss and drives to long-on for one.
short and flat, Misbah tries to work it square but can't get it away.
Misbah walks this way and that before getting the front foot across decisively and sweeping over square leg for a couple.
another sweep, keeps it along the ground this time and gets two more.
tossed up outside leg and turning in, Misbah lap-sweeps now and gets another run.

a sorry end this for Sri Lanka. Chandimal at mid-off lets a powerful drive go through him. Sparkling footwork again from Umar, he charges out, gets to the flight and drills this powerfully, but it should have been stopped.
tossed up on off stump, Misbah leans out to defend.
holds the length back a touch, Misbah is on the front foot again as he blocks.

fifth time unlucky! Misbah perishes to the reverse sweep. Too late for Sri Lanka's liking, though. Tossed up outside off and breaking away, he puts the knee down as is his wont, reverses the grip and reverse-lashes it. This time, it takes the top edge and goes easily into the hands of the man behind square. He has a world with Umar on his way back - "Finish it off," I guess, is what he said.
Afridi paddle-sweeps this first ball as it heads down the leg side and prances through for three.
Umar jumps out and works a single to wide long-on.
loopy googly, Afridi mistimes the on-drive to long-on.
he says hello to Afridi with a fierce short ball outside off, and Afridi stays out of the way.

Malinga's removed Afridi from the picture ... Ahemm, is this a late stutter? Well directed short one again, it had Afridi's ribs in its sights. He got into no position, just stayed back and proferred bat at it without ducking, the ball hit the toe-edge and ballooned up towards the slips. Sanga completes the catch.
slow full toss to Umar, 123 kph and it is nearly a yorker. Umar stays out and nudges it square.
short ball at 142 kph, Tanvir mistimes the pull to midwicket.
another bouncer! Tanvir plays it just as badly as Afridi did, jus pops it up in front of him. There's no one to take it ...
another short one, outside off this time, and Tanvir fends it away adequately. Life should be easier next over.
back of a length on the pads, Umar coolly takes a single. Over to Tanvir ...
too much width outside off, Tanvir cracks it away to deep point for a single.

Sanga goes up in earnest for a caught behind appeal. Not given, and Sri Lanka have reviewed it. Whoa, Dilhara has nearly over-stepped, but he's ok, only just ... Now on to the actual action. Back of a length outside off, Umar was trying to stay beside the line and angle it down to third man. He gets as close to the ball as possible without getting a definitive nick. There isn't any deviation, and no noise either. I think Umar is safe. Sanga wasn't as confident about going for the review, as he was with the appeal. Original appeal stays.

What a live-wire of a fifty after coming in to face a hat-trick ball. Back of a length outside off, he sets up a solid base and pieces it decisively through the covers. Stupendous timing and placement.
back of the hand slower ball, Umar spots it and defends towards cover-point.
Dilhara over-cooks the bouncer, and it sails over the head of the keeper.
back of a length slower ball, Tavir mis-hits the heave to mid-on.
Malinga is still trying the bouncers, Umar ducks for safety under this one.
short length, Umar guides it to point and still can't get the single.
Umar is sealing the deal with some pretty strokes. Slower ball wide of off stump 123 kph, Umar crouches low and makes a sirgical incision through backward point. A shot away from 4-1.
yet another bouncer. Who said lack of bouncers makes this a batsman's game? Umpires just aren't counting bouncers anymore. Bowl 6 of 'em if you like.
another one. This one porbably wasn't short enough to be called. Umar ducks under it again.
short of a length to finish the over, Umar hops on the back foot and defends to the off side.

Pakistan are trying their hardest to funk this. Tanvir's turn now. Tries to lash it away over midwicket and gets a top edge that loops up and lands in midwicket's hands. Four to win for one side. Three for the other.

All over. Umar's had enough of suicidal strokes, so he finishes it off by himself. Short ball angling in at good pace, but he latches onto it in a flash and heave-pulls wide of mid-on for an authoritative four. He bends and performs the sajda before marching out of the field. Pakistan have thumped Sri Lanka 4-1.
